author: jwasinger
content:
btw, another small update wrt the bls msm benchmarking:

After messing around with the bls state test benchmarks in Geth more, I have come to a few conclusions:
* the state test benchmarks **are** accurate measure of the precompile performance.
* while the g1 msm precompile is indeed 100% underpriced compared to the ecrecover precompile in the worst-case (non-concurrent, massive non-realistic input size), from the benchmarks I have done: I believe that a 50% price increase across the board for the MSM price model would put non-concurrent-implementation performance/pricing at roughly the same as ecrecover for "reasonable"-sized inputs (anything lte 32 pairs).

Here is a document which breaks down performance of the Geth MSM implementations on presumed-worst-case inputs with instructions for reproducing these benchmarks.  I think it should support the points above: https://hackmd.io/zLLL9ljtSNWpN5ukGot1fQ .

author: jwasinger
content: note that the scroll bar is invisible on the "Native Go" benchmarks (you will have to scroll to the right to see the gas throughput for those)
